other_tests.findings: Bony ankylosis of all interphalangeal joints on the left hand with sparing of only the distal interphalangeal joint of the middle finger; resorption of the ungual tufts of the distal phalanges at the index, ring, and small fingers, and partially at the thumb, compatible with acroosteolysis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The left hand showed more severe bone and joint abnormalities than the right hand; however, chronic flexion contracture was noted in both hands.
